actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Finance.

official_title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to permit certain full time students who have not completed their education to continue to receive child's insurance benefits after attaining age 22.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance
subjects_top_term: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Permits qualified full-time students who have not completed a degree from a four-year college to continue to receive child's insurance benefits between age 22 and age 26 under title II (Old-Age, Survivors, and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act.

titles.title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to permit certain full time students who have not completed their education to continue to receive child's insurance benefits after attaining age 22.
